lvmh-moet-hennessy-louis-vuitton.name: Bernard Arnault
lvmh-moet-hennessy-louis-vuitton.bio: Billionaire businessman who built LVMH into the world's largest luxury goods conglomerate, consistently ranked among the wealthiest people globally.

lvmh-moet-hennessy-louis-vuitton.name: Antonio Belloni
lvmh-moet-hennessy-louis-vuitton.bio: Italian-born executive who served as LVMH Group Managing Director for over two decades, overseeing global operations.

lvmh-moet-hennessy-louis-vuitton.name: Delphine Arnault
lvmh-moet-hennessy-louis-vuitton.bio: Eldest child of Bernard Arnault who rose through LVMH ranks to lead Christian Dior Couture and sits on the LVMH board.

lvmh-moet-hennessy-louis-vuitton.name: Antoine Arnault
lvmh-moet-hennessy-louis-vuitton.bio: Son of Bernard Arnault who oversees LVMH's image and communications strategy and serves as CEO of Berluti.

publicis-groupe.name: Arthur Sadoun
publicis-groupe.bio: French advertising executive who became CEO of Publicis Groupe in 2017, driving its transformation into a data-driven marketing leader.

publicis-groupe.name: Maurice Lévy
publicis-groupe.bio: Longtime CEO of Publicis Groupe who led the company for nearly three decades and engineered major acquisitions including Sapient.

publicis-groupe.name: Elisabeth Badinter
publicis-groupe.bio: French philosopher, feminist author, and daughter of Publicis founder Marcel Bleustein-Blanchet, one of the largest individual shareholders.

publicis-groupe.name: Marcel Bleustein-Blanchet
publicis-groupe.bio: French advertising pioneer who founded Publicis in 1926 and built it into one of the world's premier advertising agencies.

bnp-paribas.name: Jean-Laurent Bonnafé
bnp-paribas.bio: French banking executive who has led BNP Paribas as CEO since 2011, steering Europe's largest bank through regulatory and digital transformations.

bnp-paribas.name: Jean Lemierre
bnp-paribas.bio: Former president of the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development who became chairman of BNP Paribas in 2014.

bnp-paribas.name: Michel Pébereau
bnp-paribas.bio: Influential French banker who orchestrated the merger creating BNP Paribas in 2000 and served as chairman until 2011.

bnp-paribas.name: Thierry Laborde
bnp-paribas.bio: Senior BNP Paribas executive overseeing retail banking and services divisions across the group's European markets.

paris-shoah-memorial-m-morial-de-la-shoa.name: Jacques Fredj
paris-shoah-memorial-m-morial-de-la-shoa.bio: Longtime director of the Mémorial de la Shoah in Paris, overseeing its transformation into a major Holocaust museum and education center.

paris-shoah-memorial-m-morial-de-la-shoa.name: Serge Klarsfeld
paris-shoah-memorial-m-morial-de-la-shoa.bio: Renowned Nazi hunter and historian who documented the deportation of Jews from France and was instrumental in establishing the Memorial.

paris-shoah-memorial-m-morial-de-la-shoa.name: Beate Klarsfeld
paris-shoah-memorial-m-morial-de-la-shoa.bio: German-born French activist who, alongside her husband Serge, pursued Nazi war criminals and championed Holocaust remembrance in France.

paris-shoah-memorial-m-morial-de-la-shoa.name: Eric de Rothschild
paris-shoah-memorial-m-morial-de-la-shoa.bio: French banker and philanthropist from the Rothschild family who served as president of the Mémorial de la Shoah for many years.

alliance-isra-lite-universelle-aiu.name: Marc Eisenberg
alliance-isra-lite-universelle-aiu.bio: French businessman and communal leader who has served as president of the Alliance Israélite Universelle, overseeing its global educational network.

alliance-isra-lite-universelle-aiu.name: Adolphe Crémieux
alliance-isra-lite-universelle-aiu.bio: Nineteenth-century French-Jewish statesman and lawyer who co-founded the Alliance Israélite Universelle in 1860 to defend Jewish rights worldwide.

alliance-isra-lite-universelle-aiu.name: Jo Malka
alliance-isra-lite-universelle-aiu.bio: Senior administrator overseeing the AIU's educational programs and its network of schools across multiple countries.

alliance-isra-lite-universelle-aiu.name: Narcisse Leven
alliance-isra-lite-universelle-aiu.bio: French-Jewish lawyer and philanthropist who served as longtime president of the AIU in the late 19th and early 20th centuries.

consistoire-central-de-france.name: Joël Mergui
consistoire-central-de-france.bio: French communal leader serving as president of the Consistoire Central, the official body governing Orthodox Jewish religious life in France.

consistoire-central-de-france.name: Haïm Korsia
consistoire-central-de-france.bio: Chief Rabbi of France since 2014, serving as the spiritual leader of French Jewry and an interreligious dialogue advocate.

consistoire-central-de-france.name: Napoleon Bonaparte
consistoire-central-de-france.bio: French emperor who established the Consistoire system in 1808 to organize Jewish communal life within the framework of the French state.

consistoire-central-de-france.name: Gilles Bernheim
consistoire-central-de-france.bio: Philosopher and rabbi who served as Grand Rabbi of France from 2008 to 2013, known for bridging Jewish thought and French philosophy.

cr-if-representative-council-of-french-j.name: Yonathan Arfi
cr-if-representative-council-of-french-j.bio: French communal leader elected president of CRIF, the representative umbrella body of French Jewish organizations, advocating against antisemitism.

cr-if-representative-council-of-french-j.name: Francis Kalifat
cr-if-representative-council-of-french-j.bio: French Jewish leader who served as CRIF president, championing Holocaust remembrance and combating rising antisemitism in France.

cr-if-representative-council-of-french-j.name: Roger Cukierman
cr-if-representative-council-of-french-j.bio: French banker and communal leader who served as CRIF president and was a prominent voice on Jewish affairs in France.

cr-if-representative-council-of-french-j.name: Richard Prasquier
cr-if-representative-council-of-french-j.bio: French physician and communal leader who led CRIF and was active in Holocaust memory and French-Israeli relations.

european-jewish-congress.name: Ariel Muzicant
european-jewish-congress.bio: Austrian-Jewish communal leader and businessman who served as vice president of the European Jewish Congress and headed the Austrian Jewish community.

european-jewish-congress.name: Moshe Kantor
european-jewish-congress.bio: Russian-born industrialist and philanthropist who led the European Jewish Congress for over a decade, championing tolerance and combating antisemitism.

european-jewish-congress.name: Marie van der Zyl
european-jewish-congress.bio: British lawyer and communal leader who contributed to the European Jewish Congress while serving as president of the Board of Deputies of British Jews.

european-jewish-congress.name: Raya Kalenova
european-jewish-congress.bio: Senior executive overseeing the European Jewish Congress's day-to-day operations and pan-European Jewish advocacy efforts.

french-jewish-scouts-eclaireurs-israelit.name: Robert Gamzon
french-jewish-scouts-eclaireurs-israelit.bio: French-Jewish engineer and youth leader who founded the Éclaireurs Israélites de France in 1923 and led Jewish resistance efforts during WWII.

french-jewish-scouts-eclaireurs-israelit.name: Robert Weil
french-jewish-scouts-eclaireurs-israelit.bio: Early leader of the EEIF who helped build the organization's educational and camping programs for French Jewish youth.

french-jewish-scouts-eclaireurs-israelit.name: Denise Lévy
french-jewish-scouts-eclaireurs-israelit.bio: Prominent woman leader in the EEIF who guided the movement through modernization while maintaining its Jewish and scouting values.

french-jewish-scouts-eclaireurs-israelit.name: Michel Serfaty
french-jewish-scouts-eclaireurs-israelit.bio: French rabbi and interfaith activist who was shaped by his EEIF experience and became known for Jewish-Muslim dialogue initiatives.

mahj-museum-of-art-and-history-of-judais.name: Paul Salmona
mahj-museum-of-art-and-history-of-judais.bio: Art historian and museum professional who directed the Musée d'Art et d'Histoire du Judaïsme in the Marais district of Paris.

mahj-museum-of-art-and-history-of-judais.name: Laurence Sigal
mahj-museum-of-art-and-history-of-judais.bio: Founding director of the MAHJ who oversaw its establishment in the Hôtel de Saint-Aignan and built its acclaimed permanent collection.

mahj-museum-of-art-and-history-of-judais.name: Claude-Gérard Marcus
mahj-museum-of-art-and-history-of-judais.bio: French politician and art patron who championed the creation of a Jewish art and history museum in Paris.

mahj-museum-of-art-and-history-of-judais.name: Anne-Hélène Hoog
mahj-museum-of-art-and-history-of-judais.bio: Senior curator at the MAHJ responsible for organizing major exhibitions on Jewish art, culture, and history.

ose-children-s-rescue-organization.name: Patricia Sitruk
ose-children-s-rescue-organization.bio: French communal leader who led OSE's modern operations providing health, education, and social services to vulnerable populations.

ose-children-s-rescue-organization.name: Jean-François Guthmann
ose-children-s-rescue-organization.bio: French philanthropist and communal leader who served as president of OSE, continuing its mission of child welfare and health services.

ose-children-s-rescue-organization.name: Andrée Salomon
ose-children-s-rescue-organization.bio: Social worker who directed OSE's clandestine rescue network during WWII, saving hundreds of Jewish children from deportation in France.

ose-children-s-rescue-organization.name: Ernst Papanek
ose-children-s-rescue-organization.bio: Austrian-born educator who directed OSE children's homes in France before WWII, pioneering progressive methods for refugee children's care.

memorial-de-la-shoah-drancy.name: Jacques Fredj
memorial-de-la-shoah-drancy.bio: Director of the Mémorial de la Shoah network including the Drancy site, overseeing Holocaust education and remembrance programs.

memorial-de-la-shoah-drancy.name: Serge Klarsfeld
memorial-de-la-shoah-drancy.bio: Famed Nazi hunter whose decades of research on deportations from Drancy was instrumental in establishing the memorial at the former internment camp.

memorial-de-la-shoah-drancy.name: Annette Wieviorka
memorial-de-la-shoah-drancy.bio: Prominent French historian of the Holocaust who contributed to the scholarly foundation and exhibits of the Drancy memorial.

memorial-de-la-shoah-drancy.name: Beate Klarsfeld
memorial-de-la-shoah-drancy.bio: Activist who alongside her husband Serge fought for recognition of French complicity in Holocaust deportations via the Drancy transit camp.

tot-al-energies.name: Patrick Pouyanné
tot-al-energies.bio: French engineer and executive who has led TotalEnergies since 2014, steering its transformation toward multi-energy and renewables.

tot-al-energies.name: Christophe de Margerie
tot-al-energies.bio: Charismatic French oil executive who led Total from 2007 until his death in a 2014 plane crash, expanding the company's global footprint.

tot-al-energies.name: Thierry Desmarest
tot-al-energies.bio: French executive who led Total through major mergers with Petrofina and Elf Aquitaine, creating one of the world's largest energy companies.

tot-al-energies.name: Helle Kristoffersen
tot-al-energies.bio: Senior TotalEnergies executive overseeing the company's strategic planning and its transition toward sustainable energy solutions.

sanofi.name: Paul Hudson
sanofi.bio: British pharmaceutical executive who became Sanofi CEO in 2019, refocusing the company on immunology, oncology, and rare diseases.

sanofi.name: Serge Weinberg
sanofi.bio: French businessman who has chaired Sanofi's board, bringing extensive experience from private equity and corporate governance.

sanofi.name: Olivier Brandicourt
sanofi.bio: French physician and pharmaceutical executive who led Sanofi from 2015 to 2019, restructuring its R&D pipeline.

sanofi.name: Chris Viehbacher
sanofi.bio: German-Canadian executive who led Sanofi from 2008 to 2014, expanding its presence in emerging markets and diversified health.

danone.name: Antoine de Saint-Affrique
danone.bio: Belgian-born executive who became Danone CEO in 2021, tasked with revitalizing growth across dairy, water, and nutrition divisions.

danone.name: Franck Riboud
danone.bio: Son of Danone founder figure Antoine Riboud, who led Danone as CEO for nearly two decades and shaped its health-focused mission.

danone.name: Emmanuel Faber
danone.bio: French executive who championed Danone's social and environmental mission before being ousted in 2021 amid activist investor pressure.

danone.name: Antoine Riboud
danone.bio: Visionary French industrialist who transformed a regional glass company into the global food giant Danone and pioneered corporate social responsibility.

bolloré-group.name: Vincent Bolloré
bolloré-group.bio: French billionaire industrialist who built the Bolloré Group into a major conglomerate spanning media, logistics, and energy storage.

bolloré-group.name: Cyrille Bolloré
bolloré-group.bio: Son of Vincent Bolloré who took over as CEO of the Bolloré Group, leading its next generation of diversified industrial operations.

bolloré-group.name: Yannick Bolloré
bolloré-group.bio: Son of Vincent Bolloré who chairs Vivendi, the media conglomerate controlled by the Bolloré Group.

bolloré-group.name: Cédric de Bailliencourt
bolloré-group.bio: Senior executive overseeing financial operations and strategy for the diversified Bolloré Group conglomerate.

fondation-pour-la-m-moire-de-la-shoah.name: David de Rothschild
fondation-pour-la-m-moire-de-la-shoah.bio: French banker and philanthropist who led the Fondation pour la Mémoire de la Shoah, dedicated to Holocaust remembrance, education, and solidarity.

fondation-pour-la-m-moire-de-la-shoah.name: Simone Veil
fondation-pour-la-m-moire-de-la-shoah.bio: Iconic French stateswoman and Holocaust survivor who served as the first president of the Foundation, embodying its mission of remembrance.

fondation-pour-la-m-moire-de-la-shoah.name: Philippe Allouche
fondation-pour-la-m-moire-de-la-shoah.bio: Director overseeing the Foundation's programs supporting Holocaust research, education, Jewish culture, and assistance to survivors.

fondation-pour-la-m-moire-de-la-shoah.name: Serge Klarsfeld
fondation-pour-la-m-moire-de-la-shoah.bio: Legendary Nazi hunter and historian whose work documenting the Shoah in France is central to the Foundation's mission.

fonds-social-juif-unifi-fsju.name: Ariel Goldmann
fonds-social-juif-unifi-fsju.bio: French lawyer and communal leader who presides over the FSJU, the central fundraising and social services body for French Jewry.

fonds-social-juif-unifi-fsju.name: Diana Garel
fonds-social-juif-unifi-fsju.bio: Executive leading the FSJU's operations across education, culture, and social welfare programs for the French Jewish community.

fonds-social-juif-unifi-fsju.name: David Saada
fonds-social-juif-unifi-fsju.bio: Communal executive who led the FSJU's day-to-day operations and expanded its range of social and educational programs.

fonds-social-juif-unifi-fsju.name: Pierre Besnainou
fonds-social-juif-unifi-fsju.bio: French-Jewish communal leader and businessman who served as FSJU president and was active in European Jewish affairs.

fondation-france-isra-l.name: Nicole Guedj
fondation-france-isra-l.bio: French lawyer and former government minister who has led the Fondation France-Israël promoting cultural and scientific ties between the two countries.

fondation-france-isra-l.name: Pierre Besnainou
fondation-france-isra-l.bio: French-Jewish communal leader who championed Franco-Israeli cultural exchange and cooperation through the Foundation.

fondation-france-isra-l.name: Bernard Cazeneuve
fondation-france-isra-l.bio: Former French Prime Minister associated with strengthening France-Israel relations through diplomatic and cultural channels.

fondation-france-isra-l.name: Joël Rubinfeld
fondation-france-isra-l.bio: Belgian-born activist and communal leader who contributed to European and Franco-Israeli advocacy initiatives.

french-jewish-intelligentsia-network.name: Bernard-Henri Lévy
french-jewish-intelligentsia-network.bio: Celebrated French-Jewish philosopher, author, and public intellectual known as 'BHL,' a leading voice on human rights and Jewish identity.

french-jewish-intelligentsia-network.name: Alain Finkielkraut
french-jewish-intelligentsia-network.bio: French philosopher, author, and Académie Française member known for his writings on Jewish identity, modernity, and French culture.

french-jewish-intelligentsia-network.name: Elisabeth Badinter
french-jewish-intelligentsia-network.bio: Renowned French feminist philosopher and author whose Jewish heritage informs her influential writings on universalism and equality.

french-jewish-intelligentsia-network.name: Simone Veil
french-jewish-intelligentsia-network.bio: Holocaust survivor who became one of France's most respected stateswomen, serving as health minister and European Parliament president.

jewish-community-of-paris.name: Joël Mergui
jewish-community-of-paris.bio: Communal leader heading the Consistoire of Paris, the body governing Orthodox Jewish religious institutions in the French capital.

jewish-community-of-paris.name: Moshe Sebbag
jewish-community-of-paris.bio: Grand Rabbi of the Grande Synagogue de la Victoire, serving as a leading religious authority for the Parisian Jewish community.

jewish-community-of-paris.name: Michel Gugenheim
jewish-community-of-paris.bio: Former Grand Rabbi of Paris who served the community's religious needs and promoted interreligious understanding for decades.

jewish-community-of-paris.name: Haïm Korsia
jewish-community-of-paris.bio: Chief Rabbi of France who also plays a central role in Parisian Jewish life and broader communal leadership.

centre-communautaire-de-paris-le-marais.name: Claude Nature
centre-communautaire-de-paris-le-marais.bio: Communal leader overseeing the Centre Communautaire de Paris in the historic Marais district, a hub for Jewish cultural and social life.

centre-communautaire-de-paris-le-marais.name: Yaël Hirsch
centre-communautaire-de-paris-le-marais.bio: Cultural organizer who developed programming at the Le Marais community center celebrating Jewish arts, heritage, and intellectual life.

centre-communautaire-de-paris-le-marais.name: Moïse Cohen
centre-communautaire-de-paris-le-marais.bio: Communal leader who presided over the Le Marais Jewish community center, fostering social cohesion and cultural activities.

centre-communautaire-de-paris-le-marais.name: Delphine Horvilleur
centre-communautaire-de-paris-le-marais.bio: One of France's few female rabbis, a prominent author and speaker closely connected to progressive Jewish life in the Marais.

grand-synagogue-of-paris.name: Moshe Sebbag
grand-synagogue-of-paris.bio: Principal rabbi of the Grande Synagogue de la Victoire, the most prestigious synagogue in France, since the 1990s.

grand-synagogue-of-paris.name: Joël Mergui
grand-synagogue-of-paris.bio: Head of the Paris Consistoire, which administers the Grand Synagogue and other Jewish religious institutions in Paris.

grand-synagogue-of-paris.name: Gustave de Rothschild
grand-synagogue-of-paris.bio: Nineteenth-century Rothschild family member who was a major patron in the construction and support of the Grand Synagogue.

grand-synagogue-of-paris.name: Zadoc Kahn
grand-synagogue-of-paris.bio: Influential late-19th-century Grand Rabbi of France who presided at the Grand Synagogue and championed Jewish integration and rights.

centre-european-du-juda-sme.name: Joël Mergui
centre-european-du-juda-sme.bio: Communal leader who championed the creation of the Centre Européen du Judaïsme as a modern hub for Jewish life in Paris.

centre-european-du-juda-sme.name: Haïm Korsia
centre-european-du-juda-sme.bio: Chief Rabbi of France who supported and inaugurated the Centre Européen du Judaïsme as a spiritual and cultural landmark.

centre-european-du-juda-sme.name: Emmanuel Macron
centre-european-du-juda-sme.bio: President of France who inaugurated the Centre Européen du Judaïsme in 2019, highlighting its importance to French cultural life.

centre-european-du-juda-sme.name: Bruno Grisinelli
centre-european-du-juda-sme.bio: Administrative director overseeing the operations, programming, and outreach of the Centre Européen du Judaïsme in Paris.

jewish-community-of-strasbourg.name: Thierry Roos
jewish-community-of-strasbourg.bio: Lawyer and communal leader who has presided over the Jewish community of Strasbourg, one of the largest and oldest in France.

jewish-community-of-strasbourg.name: René Gutman
jewish-community-of-strasbourg.bio: Longtime Grand Rabbi of Strasbourg who led the community's religious life and promoted interfaith dialogue in Alsace.

jewish-community-of-strasbourg.name: Harold Abraham Weill
jewish-community-of-strasbourg.bio: Rabbi serving the Strasbourg Jewish community, continuing its rich Alsatian Jewish religious tradition.

jewish-community-of-strasbourg.name: Claude Marx
jewish-community-of-strasbourg.bio: Historical communal figure who helped rebuild and strengthen the Strasbourg Jewish community in the post-war era.

museum-of-jewish-art-and-history-paris.name: Paul Salmona
museum-of-jewish-art-and-history-paris.bio: Art historian serving as director of the Museum of Jewish Art and History housed in the Hôtel de Saint-Aignan in Paris's Marais.

museum-of-jewish-art-and-history-paris.name: Laurence Sigal
museum-of-jewish-art-and-history-paris.bio: Curator and museum professional who established the Museum of Jewish Art and History, shaping its permanent exhibitions.

museum-of-jewish-art-and-history-paris.name: Anne-Hélène Hoog
museum-of-jewish-art-and-history-paris.bio: Senior curator responsible for major exhibitions tracing Jewish history, art, and cultural heritage at the museum.

museum-of-jewish-art-and-history-paris.name: Claude-Gérard Marcus
museum-of-jewish-art-and-history-paris.bio: French politician and collector who was instrumental in the creation of a dedicated Jewish art and history museum in Paris.

centre-europeen-du-judaisme.name: Joël Mergui
centre-europeen-du-judaisme.bio: Key figure behind the Centre Européen du Judaïsme project, representing the Paris Consistoire's vision for a modern Jewish center.

centre-europeen-du-judaisme.name: Haïm Korsia
centre-europeen-du-judaisme.bio: Chief Rabbi of France who played a central role in launching the Centre Européen du Judaïsme as a spiritual and cultural space.

centre-europeen-du-judaisme.name: Bruno Grisinelli
centre-europeen-du-judaisme.bio: Director responsible for the daily management and cultural programming of the Centre Européen du Judaïsme in Paris.

centre-europeen-du-judaisme.name: Emmanuel Macron
centre-europeen-du-judaisme.bio: President of France who officially opened the Centre Européen du Judaïsme in October 2019 in a public ceremony.

fondation-france-israel.name: Nicole Guedj
fondation-france-israel.bio: Lawyer, former French Secretary of State, and president of the Fondation France-Israël, promoting bilateral cultural exchanges.

fondation-france-israel.name: Pierre Besnainou
fondation-france-israel.bio: Businessman and communal leader who headed the Foundation, fostering Franco-Israeli innovation and cultural partnerships.

fondation-france-israel.name: Bernard Cazeneuve
fondation-france-israel.bio: Former French Prime Minister whose government strengthened security and cultural cooperation ties with Israel.

fondation-france-israel.name: Daniel Shek
fondation-france-israel.bio: Former Israeli Ambassador to France who worked closely with the Foundation to strengthen Franco-Israeli relations.

fonds-social-juif-unifie-fsju.name: Ariel Goldmann
fonds-social-juif-unifie-fsju.bio: French lawyer and philanthropist presiding over the FSJU, the main fundraising and social services organization of French Jewry.

fonds-social-juif-unifie-fsju.name: Diana Garel
fonds-social-juif-unifie-fsju.bio: Executive director managing the FSJU's broad portfolio of educational, cultural, and welfare programs for the Jewish community.

fonds-social-juif-unifie-fsju.name: David Saada
fonds-social-juif-unifie-fsju.bio: Longtime executive who oversaw the FSJU's growth and modernization of its communal service programs across France.

fonds-social-juif-unifie-fsju.name: Pierre Besnainou
fonds-social-juif-unifie-fsju.bio: Communal leader and European Jewish figure who served as FSJU president and later led the European Jewish Congress.

consistoire-israelite-de-france.name: Joël Mergui
consistoire-israelite-de-france.bio: President of the Consistoire Israélite de France, the historic body governing Jewish religious life and institutions across France.

consistoire-israelite-de-france.name: Haïm Korsia
consistoire-israelite-de-france.bio: Chief Rabbi of France serving under the Consistoire's religious framework, providing spiritual leadership to French Jewry.

consistoire-israelite-de-france.name: Gilles Bernheim
consistoire-israelite-de-france.bio: Philosopher-rabbi who served as Grand Rabbi of France under the Consistoire from 2008 until his resignation in 2013.

consistoire-israelite-de-france.name: Joseph Sitruk
consistoire-israelite-de-france.bio: Tunisian-born rabbi who served as Grand Rabbi of France from 1987 to 2008, known for strengthening Orthodox practice.

memorial-de-la-shoah.name: Jacques Fredj
memorial-de-la-shoah.bio: Director of the Mémorial de la Shoah, France's leading Holocaust museum, education center, and documentation archive in Paris.

memorial-de-la-shoah.name: Serge Klarsfeld
memorial-de-la-shoah.bio: Iconic Nazi hunter and historian whose lifelong documentation of Holocaust deportations from France underpins the Memorial's archives.

memorial-de-la-shoah.name: Simone Veil
memorial-de-la-shoah.bio: Holocaust survivor and beloved French stateswoman whose life and legacy are central to the Memorial's narrative of remembrance.

memorial-de-la-shoah.name: Eric de Rothschild
memorial-de-la-shoah.bio: Banker and philanthropist from the Rothschild family who served as president of the Mémorial de la Shoah.

crif-representative-council-of-french-je.name: Yonathan Arfi
crif-representative-council-of-french-je.bio: Elected president of CRIF, the umbrella organization representing French Jewish community institutions and combating antisemitism.

crif-representative-council-of-french-je.name: Francis Kalifat
crif-representative-council-of-french-je.bio: Communal leader who headed CRIF and was a vocal advocate against antisemitism and for Holocaust remembrance in France.

crif-representative-council-of-french-je.name: Roger Cukierman
crif-representative-council-of-french-je.bio: French banker and communal leader who served multiple terms as CRIF president, representing French Jewry to public authorities.

crif-representative-council-of-french-je.name: Richard Prasquier
crif-representative-council-of-french-je.bio: Cardiologist and communal leader who led CRIF and championed Holocaust memory and French-Israeli relations.

alliance-israelite-universelle.name: Marc Eisenberg
alliance-israelite-universelle.bio: French entrepreneur and communal leader serving as president of the Alliance Israélite Universelle and its global network of schools.

alliance-israelite-universelle.name: Adolphe Crémieux
alliance-israelite-universelle.bio: Nineteenth-century French statesman who co-founded the AIU in 1860, championing Jewish emancipation and education worldwide.

alliance-israelite-universelle.name: Jo Malka
alliance-israelite-universelle.bio: Administrative leader overseeing the AIU's educational institutions and cultural programs across France and internationally.

alliance-israelite-universelle.name: Narcisse Leven
alliance-israelite-universelle.bio: Lawyer and philanthropist who led the AIU through decades of expansion of its school network in the Mediterranean region.

mah-j-mus-e-d-art-et-d-histoire-du-juda-.name: Paul Salmona
mah-j-mus-e-d-art-et-d-histoire-du-juda-.bio: Art historian and director of the Musée d'Art et d'Histoire du Judaïsme, managing its collection and exhibitions in the Marais.

mah-j-mus-e-d-art-et-d-histoire-du-juda-.name: Laurence Sigal
mah-j-mus-e-d-art-et-d-histoire-du-juda-.bio: Pioneering museum director who led the creation of the MAHJ and established its acclaimed permanent collection of Judaica.

mah-j-mus-e-d-art-et-d-histoire-du-juda-.name: Anne-Hélène Hoog
mah-j-mus-e-d-art-et-d-histoire-du-juda-.bio: Curator who developed key exhibitions on Jewish culture, art, and intellectual history at the museum.

mah-j-mus-e-d-art-et-d-histoire-du-juda-.name: Claude-Gérard Marcus
mah-j-mus-e-d-art-et-d-histoire-du-juda-.bio: French politician who championed the project to create a museum dedicated to Jewish art and history in Paris's historic Marais quarter.

ose-oeuvre-de-secours-aux-enfants.name: Patricia Sitruk
ose-oeuvre-de-secours-aux-enfants.bio: Executive leading OSE's modern-day health, educational, and social welfare programs for children and families in France.

ose-oeuvre-de-secours-aux-enfants.name: Jean-François Guthmann
ose-oeuvre-de-secours-aux-enfants.bio: Philanthropist and communal leader serving as president of OSE, overseeing its mission of child rescue and welfare.

ose-oeuvre-de-secours-aux-enfants.name: Andrée Salomon
ose-oeuvre-de-secours-aux-enfants.bio: Social worker who led OSE's clandestine operations during the Holocaust, organizing the rescue and hiding of Jewish children.

ose-oeuvre-de-secours-aux-enfants.name: Isaac Pougatch
ose-oeuvre-de-secours-aux-enfants.bio: Educator and writer who headed OSE children's homes and educational programs, shaping Jewish youth welfare in postwar France.
